ActivityStatusEnum.description: The status of a resource. Corresponds to those used by OBO Foundry.
ActivityStatusEnum.title: ActivityStatusEnum

Aggregator.description: An aggregator of data sources. Note that this may be a data source itself, and its products may undergo changes in the process of their inclusion in the aggregator.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

contacts.description: The contact point(s) for the resource. May be an individual or organization.

domains.description: The domain(s) that the resource is relevant to.

fairsharing_id.description: The FAIRsharing ID of the resource.

funding.description: The funding source(s) for the resource.

homepage_url.description: The primary URL of the resource. This may be a link to download a specific file, a base URL to an API, or a link to a graphical interface, but it should preferentially be the main page documenting the resource.

id.description: The identifier of an entity. This is used to identify it within the registry.

infores_id.description: The Infores ID of the resource. Do not include the 'infores' prefix.

language.description: The human language of the resource.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

license.description: The license of the resource. Individual products may have their own licenses.

name.description: The human-readable name of the resource.

products.description: The products or representations of the resource.

repository.description: A main version control repository for the resource. Specific products may have their own repositories.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

Aggregator.title: Aggregator

CollectionEnum.description: Specific collections for grouping KG-Registry entries.
CollectionEnum.title: CollectionEnum

CompressionEnum.description: The type of compression used with a product.
CompressionEnum.title: CompressionEnum

Contact.description: A contact point for a resource or product.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

contact_details.description: A field for contact details, including email, GitHub, and contact-specific URLs.

Contact.title: Contact

ContactDetails.description: A field for details about how to contact a person or organization.

contact_type_name.description: The name of the contact detail, if the contact_type is "other". For example, if the contact value is a username at the Gumball Project's GitLab, this may be "Gumball Project GitLab".

contact_type_url.description: The URL of the contact detail, if the contact_type is "other". For example, if the contact value is a username at the Gumball Project's GitLab, this may be "https://gitlab.gumballproject.org/".

value.description: The value of the contact detail. For example, an email address or URL. Do not include a prefix.

ContactDetails.title: ContactDetails

DataModel.description: A data model, such as an ontology or schema. May be used in construction of a knowledge graph.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

contacts.description: The contact point(s) for the resource. May be an individual or organization.

domains.description: The domain(s) that the resource is relevant to.

fairsharing_id.description: The FAIRsharing ID of the resource.

funding.description: The funding source(s) for the resource.

homepage_url.description: The primary URL of the resource. This may be a link to download a specific file, a base URL to an API, or a link to a graphical interface, but it should preferentially be the main page documenting the resource.

id.description: The identifier of an entity. This is used to identify it within the registry.

infores_id.description: The Infores ID of the resource. Do not include the 'infores' prefix.

language.description: The human language of the resource.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

license.description: The license of the resource. Individual products may have their own licenses.

name.description: The human-readable name of the resource.

products.description: The products or representations of the resource.

repository.description: A main version control repository for the resource. Specific products may have their own repositories.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

DataModel.title: DataModel

DataModelProduct.description: A product that is a data model, such as an ontology or schema.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

compatibility.description: A list of standards that the product conforms to. This is not the same as its serialization/format.

compression.description: The type of compression used with the product. If this is not specified, it is assumed to be uncompressed.

contacts.description: The contact points for the product. May be an individual or organization.

dump_format.description: The format of a dump of the product as a file. Note the product may also be compressed.

format.description: The format or serialization of the product. Generally corresponds to the file extension.

id.description: The identifier of an entity. This is used to identify it within the registry.

infores_id.description: The Infores ID of the product. Do not include the 'infores' prefix.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

license.description: The license of the product. This may differ from that of the parent resource.

name.description: The human-readable name of the product.

original_source.description: The original source(s) of the product, referred to  by the identifier of each resource. This may be the parent resource or another resource. This may also be a specific product.

produced_by.description: The process(es) that produced the product, referred to by the identifier of each process.

product_url.description: The URL of the product. This may be a link to download a specific file, a base URL to an API, or a link to a graphical interface.

repository.description: A main version control repository for the product.

secondary_source.description: The source(s) of the product, other than its original source, referred to by the identifier of each resource. This may be an Aggregator or another resource. This may also be a specific product.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

DataModelProduct.title: DataModelProduct

DataSource.description: A data source. One data source may have multiple products.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

contacts.description: The contact point(s) for the resource. May be an individual or organization.

fairsharing_id.description: The FAIRsharing ID of the resource.

infores_id.description: The Infores ID of the resource. Do not include the 'infores' prefix.

language.description: The human language of the resource.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

license.description: The license of the resource. Individual products may have their own licenses.

name.description: The human-readable name of the resource.

products.description: The products or representations of the resource.

repository.description: A main version control repository for the resource. Specific products may have their own repositories.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

DataSource.title: DataSource

DomainEnum.description: A domain that a resource is relevant to.
DomainEnum.title: DomainEnum

DumpFormatEnum.description: The format of a dump of a product, generally a graph, as a file. Note the product may also be compressed.
DumpFormatEnum.title: DumpFormatEnum

FundingSource.description: A funding source for a resource.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

id.description: The identifier of an entity. This is used to identify it within the registry.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

FundingSource.title: FundingSource

GraphProduct.description: A product that is a graph, represented as nodes and edges.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

compatibility.description: A list of standards that the product conforms to. This is not the same as its serialization/format.

compression.description: The type of compression used with the product. If this is not specified, it is assumed to be uncompressed.

contacts.description: The contact points for the product. May be an individual or organization.

dump_format.description: The format of a dump of the product as a file. Note the product may also be compressed.

edge_count.description: The number of edges in the graph.

format.description: The format or serialization of the product. Generally corresponds to the file extension.

id.description: The identifier of an entity. This is used to identify it within the registry.

infores_id.description: The Infores ID of the product. Do not include the 'infores' prefix.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

license.description: The license of the product. This may differ from that of the parent resource.

name.description: The human-readable name of the product.

node_categories.description: The node categories in the graph.

node_count.description: The number of nodes in the graph.

original_source.description: The original source(s) of the product, referred to  by the identifier of each resource. This may be the parent resource or another resource. This may also be a specific product.

predicates.description: The predicate types in the graph.

produced_by.description: The process(es) that produced the product, referred to by the identifier of each process.

product_url.description: The URL of the product. This may be a link to download a specific file, a base URL to an API, or a link to a graphical interface.

repository.description: A main version control repository for the product.

secondary_source.description: The source(s) of the product, other than its original source, referred to by the identifier of each resource. This may be an Aggregator or another resource. This may also be a specific product.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

GraphProduct.title: GraphProduct

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

contact_details.description: A field for contact details, including email, GitHub, and contact-specific URLs.

orcid.description: The ORCID of the individual. Do not include the "https://orcid.org/" prefix.

KnowledgeGraph.description: A knowledge graph resource. This is any heterogeneous collection of data that is represented as nodes (entities) and edges (relationships) between them. The nodes and edges may have attributes associated with them. This is not identical to the graph *product*, as a single KnowledgeGraph may have multiple products or representations.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

components.description: The components of the knowledge graph.

contacts.description: The contact point(s) for the resource. May be an individual or organization.

creator.description: The person or organization responsible for creating the knowledge graph.

date_created.description: The date the knowledge graph was created.

date_modified.description: The date the knowledge graph was last modified.

domains.description: The domain(s) that the resource is relevant to.

fairsharing_id.description: The FAIRsharing ID of the resource.

funding.description: The funding source(s) for the resource.

homepage_url.description: The primary URL of the resource. This may be a link to download a specific file, a base URL to an API, or a link to a graphical interface, but it should preferentially be the main page documenting the resource.

id.description: The identifier of an entity. This is used to identify it within the registry.

infores_id.description: The Infores ID of the resource. Do not include the 'infores' prefix.

language.description: The human language of the resource.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

license.description: The license of the resource. Individual products may have their own licenses.

name.description: The human-readable name of the resource.

products.description: The products or representations of the resource.

repository.description: A main version control repository for the resource. Specific products may have their own repositories.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

KnowledgeGraph.title: KnowledgeGraph

License.description: A license for a resource or product. The id field should be a URL to the license text, e.g., https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

logo.description: The URL of a logo for the license. This is added at metadata parsing time.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

ProgrammingInterface.description: A product that is a programming interface (API) to a resource.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

compatibility.description: A list of standards that the product conforms to. This is not the same as its serialization/format.

compression.description: The type of compression used with the product. If this is not specified, it is assumed to be uncompressed.

connection_url.description: A URL specific to the product. For example, a URL to a specific Neo4j database. Do not include a prefix.

contacts.description: The contact points for the product. May be an individual or organization.

dump_format.description: The format of a dump of the product as a file. Note the product may also be compressed.

format.description: The format or serialization of the product. Generally corresponds to the file extension.

id.description: The identifier of an entity. This is used to identify it within the registry.

infores_id.description: The Infores ID of the product. Do not include the 'infores' prefix.

is_neo4j.description: Whether the API is for a Neo4j database.

is_public.description: Whether the API is publicly accessible, or requires only publicly provided credentials.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

license.description: The license of the product. This may differ from that of the parent resource.

name.description: The human-readable name of the product.

original_source.description: The original source(s) of the product, referred to  by the identifier of each resource. This may be the parent resource or another resource. This may also be a specific product.

produced_by.description: The process(es) that produced the product, referred to by the identifier of each process.

product_url.description: The URL of the product. This may be a link to download a specific file, a base URL to an API, or a link to a graphical interface.

repository.description: A main version control repository for the product.

secondary_source.description: The source(s) of the product, other than its original source, referred to by the identifier of each resource. This may be an Aggregator or another resource. This may also be a specific product.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

ProgrammingInterface.title: ProgrammingInterface

Publication.description: A publication associated with a resource. Its id should be a DOI (with prefix), but a URL is acceptable if a DOI is not available.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

doi.description: The DOI of the publication. This should include the doi: prefix.

id.description: The identifier of an entity. This is used to identify it within the registry.

journal.description: The journal the publication was published in.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

preferred.description: Whether this is the preferred publication for the resource.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

year.description: The year the publication was published.

Publication.title: Publication

Registry.description: A registry of knowledge graphs and their components.

resources.description: A list of entries in the registry.

Registry.title: Registry

Resource.description: A top-level class for all resources in the knowledge graph registry. Each resource may have multiple products or representations, but they will all be considered part of a the same parent resource.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

contacts.description: The contact point(s) for the resource. May be an individual or organization.

domains.description: The domain(s) that the resource is relevant to.

fairsharing_id.description: The FAIRsharing ID of the resource.

funding.description: The funding source(s) for the resource.

homepage_url.description: The primary URL of the resource. This may be a link to download a specific file, a base URL to an API, or a link to a graphical interface, but it should preferentially be the main page documenting the resource.

infores_id.description: The Infores ID of the resource. Do not include the 'infores' prefix.

language.description: The human language of the resource.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

license.description: The license of the resource. Individual products may have their own licenses.

name.description: The human-readable name of the resource.

products.description: The products or representations of the resource.

repository.description: A main version control repository for the resource. Specific products may have their own repositories.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

Resource.title: Resource

StandardCompatibility.description: Details about the compatibility of a product with a particular standard, including data models such as Biolink Model and graph standards such as KGX.

standard.description: The name of the standard that the product is compatible with.

version.description: If applicable, the most recent version of the standard that the product is known to be compatible with, e.g., 4.2.5

StandardCompatibility.title: StandardCompatibility

StandardEnum.description: The standard or standards that a product conforms to. These are not serializations, but rather the higher-level frameworks that the product is built on.
StandardEnum.title: StandardEnum

TagEnum.description: General-purpose tags that can be associated with resources.
TagEnum.title: TagEnum

Usage.description: The usage of a resource. This may be actual, experimental, or theoretical.

category.description: The category of the entity. This should be identical to its class name.

collection.description: A collection of entries in the registry. This is used to group related entries together. This is multivalued to allow for multiple collections.

id.description: The identifier of an entity. This is used to identify it within the registry.

layout.description: The layout of the entity. This is used to determine how to display the entity in the web interface. For resources, this is generally 'resource_detail'. For products, this is generally 'product_detail'.

url.description: A URL for a description or example of the usage.

users.description: The user implementing or working with the resource.

warnings.description: A list of warnings about an item to be displayed in the interface. These should primarily warn users about unavailable resources, broken links, and other obstacles to using a resource.

Usage.title: Usage

UsageEnum.description: The type of usage of a resource.
UsageEnum.title: UsageEnum
